title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1204.0 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1204.0 - General

State Regulations

Traffic with the characteristics indicated in sections
1204.1, 1204.2
and Article 2 of this

Subchapter are considered likely to impede the steady flow of traffic across a

Port Authority vehicular crossing and are prohibited from using facilities
except with special permission, granted by the manager or his designated
representative. Permission must be requested at least two hours prior to
intended passage. If permission is granted, passage may be restricted to the
time and circumstances established by the manager or his representative, and
the following inspection charges shall apply: (a) If the inspection is made on a Port

Authority vehicular crossing, an additional charge equal to one half the
established toll. (b) If the
inspection is made within the Port of New York district, but not on Port

Authority property, a charge of five dollars plus an additional charge equal to
one half the established toll. (c) If the inspection is made elsewhere, a charge equal to the actual expenses
incurred by the Port Authority in making the inspection plus an additional
charge equal to one half the established toll. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1204.0

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
